        <header>
            <img src="https://i.imgur.com/placeholder.png" alt="Alt Outdoors Sussex" class="logo" style="background: transparent;">
        </header>

        <div class="tabs">
            <button class="tab active" onclick="openTab('home')">Home</button>
            <button class="tab" onclick="openTab('contact')">Contact</button>
            <button class="tab" onclick="openTab('policies')">Policies and Documents</button>
            <button class="tab" onclick="openTab('mission')">Our Mission</button>
        </div>

        <div class="content">
            <div id="home" class="tab-content active">
                <h2>What we do</h2>
                <p>
                    Alt Outdoors provides alternative educational provision in East Sussex for children and young people who find it difficult to engage in traditional, full-time education. We use outdoor learning and practical, experience-based activities to support wellbeing, confidence, and positive engagement with learning. Our programmes are designed to be supportive, inclusive, and responsive to individual needs, helping young people reconnect with education in a way that feels meaningful and achievable. Alongside our core provision, we work within the local community and in partnership with other organisations and businesses to offer a range of activities that build life skills, resilience, and a sense of belonging.
                </p>
                <h3>Our Staff</h3>
                <p>
                    Alt Outdoors is run by Wilfy Nelson, a qualified teacher with over ten years' experience working in schools. Wilfy has held leadership responsibility as Head of Outdoor Education, delivering programmes up to A level, and has taught Maths, Science, and Physical Education up to GCSE. His background combines academic teaching with practical, outdoor-based learning, supporting young people with a wide range of needs and abilities. Alongside his teaching experience, Wilfy is a qualified mountain biking instructor and a qualified Personal Trainer, bringing a strong focus on physical wellbeing, engagement, and confidence-building into all aspects of the provision.
                </p>
            </div>

            <div id="contact" class="tab-content">
                <h2>Contact</h2>
                <div class="contact-info">
                    <p><strong>Email address:</strong> info@altoutdoors.co.uk</p>
                    <p>We'd love to hear from you. Whether you're interested in our programmes, have questions about our approach, or would like to discuss how we can support a young person you know, please get in touch.</p>
                </div>
            </div>

            <div id="policies" class="tab-content">
                <h2>Policies and Documents</h2>
                <p>
                    Our policies ensure children's safety, wellbeing, and positive engagement. Full policy documents are available on request or will be published here soon.
                </p>
                <ul style="list-style-type: none; padding-left: 0; margin-top: 20px;">
                    <li style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
                        <strong style="color: #a8d5ba; font-size: 1.1em;">• Safeguarding & Child Protection Policy</strong>
                        <p style="margin-left: 20px; margin-top: 5px;">Outlines how we keep children safe, respond to concerns, and comply with statutory safeguarding requirements.</p>
                    </li>
                    <li style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
                        <strong style="color: #a8d5ba; font-size: 1.1em;">• Health & Safety Policy</strong>
                        <p style="margin-left: 20px; margin-top: 5px;">Explains how we ensure a safe environment for children, staff, and visitors during all activities, including outdoor provision.</p>
                    </li>
                    <li style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
                        <strong style="color: #a8d5ba; font-size: 1.1em;">• Behaviour & Positive Engagement Policy</strong>
                        <p style="margin-left: 20px; margin-top: 5px;">Sets expectations for behaviour, promotes positive engagement, and describes how staff support children with behavioural challenges.</p>
                    </li>
                    <li style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
                        <strong style="color: #a8d5ba; font-size: 1.1em;">• Equality, Diversity & Inclusion Policy</strong>
                        <p style="margin-left: 20px; margin-top: 5px;">Details our commitment to treating every child and staff member fairly, promoting inclusion and valuing differences.</p>
                    </li>
                    <li style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
                        <strong style="color: #a8d5ba; font-size: 1.1em;">• Data Protection & Privacy Policy</strong>
                        <p style="margin-left: 20px; margin-top: 5px;">Explains how we handle personal information for children, parents, staff, and partners in line with UK GDPR.</p>
                    </li>
                    <li style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
                        <strong style="color: #a8d5ba; font-size: 1.1em;">• Complaints Policy</strong>
                        <p style="margin-left: 20px; margin-top: 5px;">Describes how parents, carers, and young people can raise concerns and how these will be addressed.</p>
                    </li>
                    <li style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
                        <strong style="color: #a8d5ba; font-size: 1.1em;">• Attendance & Admissions Policy</strong>
                        <p style="margin-left: 20px; margin-top: 5px;">Outlines eligibility for Alt Outdoors programs, how we monitor attendance, and steps to engage children regularly.</p>
                    </li>
                    <li style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
                        <strong style="color: #a8d5ba; font-size: 1.1em;">• Outdoor & Adventure Activities / Risk Assessment Policy</strong>
                        <p style="margin-left: 20px; margin-top: 5px;">Explains how we plan outdoor learning, manage risks, and ensure safety during activities like mountain biking or nature-based learning.</p>
                    </li>
                    <li style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
                        <strong style="color: #a8d5ba; font-size: 1.1em;">• Staff Recruitment & Code of Conduct Policy</strong>
                        <p style="margin-left: 20px; margin-top: 5px;">Sets out recruitment procedures, staff vetting (DBS checks), and expected professional behaviour.</p>
                    </li>
                    <li style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
                        <strong style="color: #a8d5ba; font-size: 1.1em;">• Anti-Bullying & Peer Support Policy</strong>
                        <p style="margin-left: 20px; margin-top: 5px;">Details how we prevent, identify, and address bullying, and how we support children's social and emotional wellbeing.</p>
                    </li>
                    <li style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
                        <strong style="color: #a8d5ba; font-size: 1.1em;">• First Aid & Medical Policy</strong>
                        <p style="margin-left: 20px; margin-top: 5px;">Describes first aid provision, handling of medicines, and responding to medical emergencies.</p>
                    </li>
                    <li style="margin-bottom: 20px;">
                        <strong style="color: #a8d5ba; font-size: 1.1em;">• Partnership & Community Engagement Policy</strong>
                        <p style="margin-left: 20px; margin-top: 5px;">Explains how we collaborate with partner companies and the local community to enhance activities and learning opportunities.</p>
                    </li>
                </ul>
            </div>

            <div id="mission" class="tab-content">
                <h2>Our Mission</h2>
                <p>
                    Our mission is to give every child the opportunity to succeed by recognising that traditional classroom learning does not work for everyone. We aim to holistically support and understand the young people we work with, valuing their individual strengths, needs, and experiences. Through meaningful, engaging, and supportive provision, we seek to build confidence, improve wellbeing, and inspire positive future opportunities for each young person.
                </p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

    <script>
        function openTab(tabName) {
            const contents = document.querySelectorAll('.tab-content');
            const tabs = document.querySelectorAll('.tab');
            
            contents.forEach(content => {
                content.classList.remove('active');
            });
            
            tabs.forEach(tab => {
                tab.classList.remove('active');
            });
            
            document.getElementById(tabName).classList.add('active');
            event.target.classList.add('active');
        }
    </script>
</body>
</html>
